characters: THE GOLDEN PEN WITH ELABORATE MAGICAL LOCK
A MAGICAL IMAGE SHIFT, (OR A CHEAP DISSOLVE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the middle of a marble floor, a single display case to by a crystal dome. DISTANT BUZZING. A SHAFT of light appears. Then a BURNING INCENSE STICK. mm wafts down.

dialogues.speaker: TWISTING PULL OUT
dialogues.text: The incense stick is upside down, being lowered into the room. As the smoke spreads, it reveals laser beams that f a security barrier. The incense stick is held by a muscular hand, followed by powerful forearm sporting the tattoo of a Chinese Dragon. Black hair, a black headband with red Chinese characters, dark eyes in a handsome, upside-down face; followed by th rest of BOBBY WANG -- in red muscle shirt and black jeans He is tied upside-down with a red nylon rope. His powerfu body moves like a contortionist to avoid the interlocking laser matrix as he's lowered toward the display case. A thin tube slides down his arm. A liquid drops onto the glass and HISSES as it flows in rivulets down the side. B takes a hammer, covers the crystal with a cloth and taps gently. CRACK. Bobby carefully pries a piece away. He rea in and plucks a JADE ARTIFACT from its pedestal.

dialogues.speaker: CU
dialogues.text: THE CHAI TAO... a piece of jade carved into part of a Chi ideogram... a puzzle in Chinese characters.

dialogues.speaker: CU
dialogues.text: A 3D rendering of the JADE PIECE rotates. Text windows ap connecting it to historical references..."T'ang Dynasty."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVE TAYLOR studies his computer. He's 29, smart and confident. He studies a hologram of the SAME JADE ARTIFAC Using a voice-recognition computer, he tries to fit it an TWO OTHER SHAPES into a complete CHINESE PUZZLE; the CHAI TAO. He's also on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: .. ROTATE LEFT 10.
dialogues.text: Yeah Dad, I know what time it is but I thought you'd like to know. The piece we just put on display, I think I found out what it really is. Something even more interesting! Yeah! A piece of the Chai Tao! The CHAI TAO! Well, according to legend it was created by YAMA, the God of Hell. It's the key to unearthly power.

dialogues.speaker: CU COMPUTER SCREEN
dialogues.text: The 3D model, breaks into three pieces, two phantom piece rendered in wire-frame, the museum's piece in full color.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: It disappeared. ..around 580 AD. Rumored to be separated into THREE PIECES, each piece held by certain moral humans for safety.

dialogues.speaker: SURVEILLANCE MONITOR
dialogues.text: One security camera is picking up Bobby Wang, but Steve doesn't notice.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: No, it's not the complete Chai Tao, but it sure looks like one of the pieces! TILT Z AXIS BACK TEN. What? I don't know. Priceless! ZOOM IN 20.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found it in the Fung collection. Maybe old man Fung was a sorcerer. What? Of course it'll be here in the morning, but it's so exciting I just thought you'd like to know. No? Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slowly slips the JADE from the case, puts it in his pocket. As he does, he dislodges the hammer. It drops fro his pocket, hits the glass with a PING. The glass shatter and falls, cutting the laser beams. ALARM! Bobby screams command into a throat mike.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Heur-La! Fi-dee! Heur-La! HEUR-LA! (Go! Now! Go go go!) Giou La! (Let's get out of here!)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve's still on the phone, engrossed in the puzzle when ALARMS BLAST.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: What's that? It's nothing... Just the alarm. (suddenly realizes) Look, I gotta go! Bye Dad! (slams down the phone.) Damn! He leaps up, runs out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YEE, an Asian-American kid in black jacket and headset po the clutch of a Ninja Cycle, ROARS off.

dialogues.speaker: AND HOLD ON THE CYCLE
dialogues.text: Tied to the back pommel is the red rope. As he rockets aw the taut rope whips by.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE ROOF
dialogues.text: A pulley in a tripod spins madly...as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOBBY is rocketed straight up and out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby FLIES into the arms of Flame Lords. They grab his g stuff it into packs. They tie the rope to the tripod, hoo onto it and drop off the roof.

dialogues.speaker: FLAME LORDS
dialogues.text: They powerslide down the rope and drop to the lawn, hitti with a rolling tumble that brings them up to their bikes. leaps off the ninja cycle as Bobby vaults right into the seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lords take off. Still roped to the tripod, Bobby guns

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tripod SNAPS FREE, LEAPS off the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tripod hits and tumbles, dragged by the Cycle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He roars by as GUARDS run out screaming into radios. The tripod tumbles across the lawn. STEVE runs out, sees the Flame Lords ZOOM by. A ROAR. He turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CYCLE bears down on him. Bobby grins maniacally. Steve DARTS left. The CYCLE darts LEFT. STEVE darts RIGHT. The CYCLE leans RIGHT STEVE feints LEFT, dives RIGHT, just as The CYCLE RIPS BY... Steve goes tumbling. He rolls and flips onto his feet, a to give chase when he notices the rope whipping at his fe He turns. The tripod tumbles straight at him. He dives to side, lands in a fountain. He comes up spewing water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COP CARS pull up, SIRENS WAILING, LIGHTS FLASHING, blocki the exit.

dialogues.speaker: THE CYCLE
dialogues.text: Bobby whips out a sword. With one swipe he parts the rope He rockets up the front hood of a cop car and launches ov it. Cops tumble out. They hop back in, just as...

dialogues.speaker: THE TRIPOD
dialogues.text: tumbles up and smashes into the cars, wedging between the

dialogues.speaker: CU
dialogues.text: Five young men and women of mixed ethnic types, mostly As Americans in leather jackets with Red Dragons. They wear bands with Chinese characters. The cycles sport dragon pennants. They're neon streaks as they ROAR by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More cops join the chase and close in. The FLAME LORDS sl into LITTLE CHINA, swerve around blind corners, boots kic sparks. They roar up a culvert. Cop cars appear at the to Lords swerve, pull up, surrounded. The Lords gun their choppers up a ramp into an alley whic turns into a luge tube. They rocket down out of sight. In a flash they are gone. In Little China they are invincible, protected by an architecture of secret ramps, tunnels and bridges. Two cops run up, find them vanished, scratch their heads in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: HEME SIC Z E_MONTAGE
dialogues.text: A mix of stills, animation and live action featuring magi and martial arts. Scenes from the first "Big Trouble" mov remind us that this is a world where anything can happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve and CLARENCE JAMES, a bearish, black SFPD Detective walk though Chinatown. Steve's haggard, sleepless, stress out and exasperated. Clarence grins and waves to merchant He is known and liked in Little China. He takes a fresh lichee nut from a fruit stand, nods to the grocer, pops i into his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Listen, I already told this to the guys downtown.

dialogues.speaker: CLARENCE
dialogues.text: Indulge me. Tell me again. Try one of these, they're great. Lu Wong, a Chinese merchant waves to him.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: I haven't had any sleep! e Clarence takes another fruit.

dialogues.speaker: CLARENCE
dialogues.text: Insomnia?! Ah... Lo quats! Good for the blood. Thanks Lu.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: You believe that?

dialogues.speaker: CLARENCE
dialogues.text: Listen, kid. There are really two Chinatowns. The one you know is restaurants and knick knack shops. The one you don't know is a mystery. You know, wizards, magic, that kind of stuff. STEVE looks at Clarence quizzically.

dialogues.speaker: CLARENCE, (CONT'D.)
dialogues.text: I know it sounds funny, but they believe it. And it affects how they behave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like breaking into a museum to steal an artifact, you mean?

dialogues.speaker: CLARENCE
dialogues.text: Yeah, exactly. Now, tell me again, what were those motorcycle guys wearing?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Black jackets with red dragons.

dialogues.speaker: CLARENCE
dialogues.text: Flame Lords.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Flame Lords?

dialogues.speaker: CLARENCE
dialogues.text: You know about the Lords?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Who hasn't?

dialogues.speaker: CLARENCE
dialogues.text: They work for Chi Lung. A real @ charmer. Extortion, smuggling, white slavery... Nothing we can pin on him yet. Any blue and green cycles?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: No. Why?

dialogues.speaker: CLARENCE
dialogues.text: White Hearts. Rival gang. Run by Egg Shen, another local character.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Egg Shen? Isn't he some sort of martial arts master?

dialogues.speaker: CLARENCE
dialogues.text: Oh, he's kind of an old crack pot but he's got lots of interests in Chinatown. A tour bus company...a curio shop. He's also supposed to be involved in the occult. Steve turns to him, curiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The occult?

dialogues.speaker: CLARENCE
dialogues.text: It's Chinatown, pal. Some of our guys come outta there babbling about demons, magic potions and stuff.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Really? Egg Shen, eh?

dialogues.speaker: CLARENCE
dialogues.text: This stuff may sound silly to us, but it's very real to them.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: It doesn't sound silly to me. I studied Asian mysticism at Berkeley. Clarence looks at him curiously, then shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: CLARENCE
dialogues.text: The older Chinese still believe in magic. Chi Lung and the Flame eS Lords take advantage of that. Gives them power. There was big trouble here a few years ago. Some truck driver wandered in, got himself shanghaied by devils at least that's what some people here think. Personally, I think the boys got hold of too much plum wine. But it raised a hell of a stink downtown.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Devils? Well...magic or no magic. I have to get the jade back.

dialogues.speaker: CLARENCE
dialogues.text: What's so special about it?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: If it's what I think it is, it's the piece of a puzzle. A very, very interesting puzzle. Clarence just looks at him straight-faced...Then turns an grabs a sweetsour bun from a vendor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! He suddenly stops, points to the street corner.

dialogues.speaker: EXT, GRANT STREET
dialogues.text: In the crowd, Yee, the Flame Lord. He spots Steve, turns takes off, slipping into the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE, (CONT'D.)
dialogues.text: That's one of them! One of the thieves! Clarence looks up from helping himself to a Chinese pastr He sees Steve bolt, turns, slams into a delivery boy. Cho Fun noodles fly all over the street. Clarence and the boy down, all tangled up.

dialogues.speaker: CLARENCE
dialogues.text: Wait! Hey, wait! But Steve's off and running. Clarence struggles up but teve's already gone, disappearing into the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Zipping in and out of the crowd, bumping tourists. He run up a street lined with shops for herbal medicines, food, tourist goods. Ahead, a glimpse. The Flame Lord's headband disappears ar a corner.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE -
dialogues.text: Broken field running through the crowd, over trash cans, around barriers. He turns the corner and finds himself in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...a QUIET, DESERTED SIDE STREET off the tourist track, l with the dim windows of small shops. But the Flame Lord h disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Pacific Power truck is parked in front of a SMALL CURIO SHOP. A boom is extended and a worker is affixing a power line to the building. BRAD, a youth in a hard hat, sets o barricades, yells to his partner in the boom basket. Steve notices the partner, a pretty Asian-American woman CHAN, 22, wearing a t-shirt and jeans. She cannot hide he beauty under a hard hat. As she leans out of her basket t wrestle with the power lines, Steve is drawn to stare. rad's a body builder with a Gold's Gym T-shirt and a Forr Gump/Fast Times at Ridgemont High demeanor. He has the ho for Kim but they're co-workers. There's an underlying sex tension as he controls her basket height.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Down a little. Up a touch.. Ahh...that's it. Down. There, that's good.

dialogues.speaker: BRAD
dialogues.text: Yeah, it was good for me. How was it for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's very pretty, lithe and strong. She leans over her p attaching wires, glances down at Brad grinning up at her.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Don't start with me, Brad. Try to be professional for once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He glowers, mumbles to himself.

dialogues.speaker: BRAD
dialogues.text: What the hell am I supposed to do, work with my eyes closed?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: See a guy in a red headband come through here? Steve's standing on a power cable. Brad moves him back.

dialogues.speaker: BRAD
dialogues.text: Excuse me, pal. Don't stand there, please. We've got hot stuff up there.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Yeah, I see. Kim leans over, straining her t-shirt. She's very sexy.  w t

dialogues.speaker: BRAD
dialogues.text: The wires, I mean.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. Sorry. Brad looks up at Kim impatiently.

dialogues.speaker: BRAD
dialogues.text: Think you'll get that tied off before the Year of the Weasel is ever and the Year of the Banana Slug begins?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Actually, it's the Year of the Pig.

dialogues.speaker: BRAD
dialogues.text: The Pig. Oh. Good.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Hey Brad, it's your year.

dialogues.speaker: BRAD
dialogues.text: Yah, funny. (to Steve) Well, it’s gonna be the year of the fat lip if you don't get off my cable. (he coils cable,mumbling to himself) I'm in the truck with her all day. It's driving me nuts. (notices Steve's still there) Something I can do for you, buddy?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: A guy. About twenty. Red Headband. Black and red jacket. Flame Lord.

dialogues.speaker: BRAD
dialogues.text: I didn't see nothing. ‘Specially no Flame Lord.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: How about an antique shop?

dialogues.speaker: BRAD
dialogues.text: This whole neighborhood is one big antique shop.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: I'm looking for Egg Shen's.  12. He shows Brad his map. Brad studies it, glances up.

dialogues.speaker: BRAD
dialogues.text: You're in luck, pal. You're here. He points at the sign EGG SHEN ANTIQUITIES hidden by Kim' basket. Steve looks around. He senses eyes watching him. Then, a shout!

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Hey! You gonna get those ties or what? They look up at the impatient girl hanging over the baske

dialogues.speaker: BRAD
dialogues.text: Keep your shirt on! (sees her stiffen, hands the map back) Damn! I'm a diabetic in a candy shop! Grumbling, he turns, slams open the truck doors -- WHANG! Kim glances down at Steve. Their eyes meet for an instant then she turns back to her work. Steve turns to the CURIO SHOP, stares in the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dark. Nooks and crannies are stuffed with Oriental curiosities. The window sports pieces of jade.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: (to himself; surprise, wonder) Min din yuk! Burma jade...Wow! The shopkeeper, EGG SHEN, an old but tough Chinese, looks from his antiquities and stares back. He comes to the fro and looks out. Steve excitedly indicates the jade.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Is that goo yuk, that sun shan yuk? (antique jade, new jade)

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: Who are you, Bok gwei?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It seems that Egg Shen is looking past him toward KIM... on the boom. He's polishing something.  be w

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Ngor hai gai dook shu. (I'm a student, an acolyte.) Ngor man nee see gow. (I need your advice.) I seek wisdom.

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: You seek pronunciation. You just called yourself a cabbage leaf... but I'm impressed.

dialogues.speaker: CU
dialogues.text: He polishes a jade piece. It's similar to the museum piec put not identical.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Steve focuses in on it. He can't quite see. He's about to make a move toward the shop when he sees a reflection in glass. He turns.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE STREET
dialogues.text: Yee stares at him, tapping ninja-sticks in his palm... Fr other corners other Flame Lords appear. SFX - BOOMING CYC ENGINES. Flame Lord choppers turn a corner and ROAR up. The Lords pull up, REVVING their choppers. One kicks over barrier. It slams into Brad's truck with a LOUD BOOM! Bra rockets out of the truck holding his head and SCREAMING.

dialogues.speaker: BRAD
dialogues.text: Hey! What the... !? Bobby Wang just laughs at him. Brad stops dead in his tra Two other Flame Lords move up grinning and swinging ninja sticks. One says something demeaning in a Dialect. Others laugh, snicker, move to surround Brad. He backs away.

dialogues.speaker: CURIO SHOP
dialogues.text: Flame Lords zoom past. An ancient Chinese nimbly darts ou their way. But Steve doesn't move fast enough. A Lord sla into him, knocks him down.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: looks down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad is quickly surrounded, threatened.

dialogues.speaker: THE STREET
dialogues.text: Bobby and the Lords move at Brad, enjoying his growing fe While others move on Steve...

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Goo Gee! La! Say Liang Jye! (Be careful, jerk) A FIGURE DROPS into the confrontation; KIM. The Lords jum back, see a pretty girl, move forward. Kim glares them do

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Bo Woo Ah! Jye...! (Get ready, stupid) What she says inflames the Lords. One moves on her. Brad grabs her, pulis her back.

dialogues.speaker: BRAD
dialogues.text: Kim, are you nuts? They're Flame Lords.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: I don't care! They are scum...

dialogues.speaker: KER DEY HAI GEU
dialogues.text: (They are pigs!) She's angry, not intimidated. She snaps a kick that brush the Lord's nose and snaps his head back. He stumbles back Kim takes a stand. The Lords surround her, mumbling threa

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Why don't you leave her alone? They stop, turn. Steve gets up.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Why would we do that?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: You're bothering her. He turns on Steve...threatening. Moves up into his face, grins menacingly.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: It's our job. We're Flame Lords.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: know who you are.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: And we know who you are.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Yeah, Seems we keep running into each other. Listen, I want to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: About what?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: The jade you stole from the Heritage Museum. The Lords stiffen, look to Bobby Wang. Bobby moves forwar

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Cop?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Assistant Curator. A beat... Bobby starts giggling.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Oh....worse. Assistant Curator! Very scary! The Lords snicker, then snap into a menacing stance. Steve takes a defensive martial-arts stance. They stop an look at his moves. Then they laugh.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: No, no, no. It's like this. He snaps into a very serious stance; deadly, practiced, agressive. The other Flame Lords also click into exaggera poses. They put on a demonstration of much better moves. Superfast fighting, flying, tumbling. Bobby finishes with tumbling, whipping combo that catches Steve by surprise, sending him into a pile of garbage.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: You should leave Little China, BOK GWEI! (white ghost/Anglo) Steve jumps to his feet. Bobby moves toward him. they mix up. Steve is surprisingly good. They exchange quick combo  16.

dialogues.speaker: KIM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: DA-LA, Saw Jye! (Go ahead, fight, stupids!) They turn.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: is moving into an attack stance. Yee goes for her. In a quick, surprising combo, Kim flips, tumbles, kicks, punch and sends Yee through the window of CHEE FUN LAUNDRY. He stumbles out, covered in dry cleaning. Bobby laughs.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Nei gum lyang! You're beautiful!

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Nei gum aie! You're short.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: (he laughs delightedly) You're angry. (swings onto his chopper) ..I...like that. Get on.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Get lost. He likes that, too. He's about to mess with her more when

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Yeah, not a bad idea. To create a diversion, Bobby breaks the Curio Shop window sets off the ALARM! A quick, unexpected blow sends Steve the garbage again. Bobby turns to Kim.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I'll see you again.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) I'll lie awake nights. He laughs, nods to the Flame Lords.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They race off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: rushes out of his shop.

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: Flame Lords!!! (they hesitate) Nei gall guy! You're off limits! A beat...then Bobby steps up to him.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Hey, old man, what kind of gang would we be if we obeyed the rules? Bobby hops on his cycle, gives Egg a mock salute, pops th clutch, SCREECHES away. Lords vanish into the woodwork.

dialogues.speaker: KIM AND BRAD
dialogues.text: Brad's awestruck at Kim's fighting skills.

dialogues.speaker: BRAD
dialogues.text: Geez, Kim! Where'd you learn to do that?

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Women's support group. She walks up to Steve, lying in the garbage, picking fish heads out of his hair. Kim stands over him, hands on hips

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Thanks for your help.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Don't mention it.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: But you shouldn't interfere. Not here.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Sorry. Thought you were in trouble. Obviously, a mistake.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: (she studies him) The Flame Lords are dangerous. You better leave Little China. 17.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about you?

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: I work here. Anyway...they'll leave me alone.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Yeah, so I see. She looks him up and down, then notices Egg. Steve follow her look, sees Egg picking up jade from his smashed displ They approach. Egg looks up, notices their interest.

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: It's not wise to stand against the Flame Lords.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: I can take care of myself.

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: Yes, I observed. Egg hands Kim a jade piece.

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: Jade...magical. The only gemstone that changes color when you touch it. It reacts to body temperature, chemistry...some say...to the person himself. Or herself.

dialogues.speaker: CU
dialogues.text: It turns lighter in Kim's hand.

dialogues.speaker: EGG
dialogues.text: He studies the jade and Kim. He seems to see something. He smiles at Kim, slips back into his store. Kim and Stev look at each other for an awkward moment. Kim admires the small gift of jade. She notices a broom, grabs it and sta sweeping glass fragments into the gutter.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: You're lucky you're in one piece.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm feeling luckier... by the moment . (he moves in) You're from Guangdong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm from Alameda.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: You're parents, then... southern Canton.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: How can you tell?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Your Cantonese...has a provincial dipthong. Que Ling?

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: You're close.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Really!?

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Yeah. They're from Oakland. Dad's a systems analyst at Rockedyne. I'm as American as Charlie Chan.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: But you speak Cantonese.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: I yell it. That's all I know... except for some curses on your ancestors, bok gwei.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: I'm not a white ghost.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: No, who are you then?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Assistant curator at the Heritage Museum.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: I thought you were kidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... really. I...I was born in Bejing. My father was teaching there. I've been studying Chinese Cc ure all my life. If the jade piece I'm looking for is what I think it is, our troubles are just beginning.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Our troubles...? She laughs at this. SIRENS and LIGHTS up ahead. Cop cars SCREECH. Glass BREAKING, cars CRASHING! BRAD runs up, hop in the truck, starts it up. Kim hands Steve closes the door

dialogues.speaker: BRAD
dialogues.text: Come on, Kim. My contract specifically states I don't have to work during earthquakes, atomic attacks, or civil disturbances. the broom, gets in the passenger seat. Steve for her. She glances curiously at him.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: What did you say you were?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: A... a collector.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Oh..? Of what?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Beautiful things. A beat. A moment between them. Imperceptibly, she smiles.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Well...I've gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Joy Geen. (goodbye)

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Yeah. See ya around. Brad pops the clutch, squeals out.  21.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Wait!

dialogues.speaker: BRAD
dialogues.text: Later! Kim stares at Steve as Brad squeals away. A CLATTER! Stev turns as Egg pulls down metal shutters on the shop.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Wait! I want to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: Can't talk now. Good bye! Egg slams the door, heavy bolts CRASH SHUT. Steve's left alone, deserted in Little China.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: acT_TWO

dialogues.speaker: CHI LUNG, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: You've done well, my son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chi Lung admires the stolen JADE as Bobby looks on proudl Chi is ancient, powerful and dressed like a mandarin. His room's furnished in exquisite art. He's evil, but witha quirky, Alan Rickman/Jeremy Irons sense of humor. Bobby's attitude has changed. He is uneasy before this powerful sorcerer. Bobby notes the frenzy with which Chi makes certain incantations. He notices that Chi's entranced by the stol jade.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Thank you, boss. By the way... this hunk of stone must be pretty important to you, huh?

dialogues.speaker: CHI LUNG
dialogues.text: (very scary, threatening) You are interested in the secrets of my power?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Ahhh...no. No. Not really. Just curious, that's all.

dialogues.speaker: CHI LUNG
dialogues.text: You wouldn't think of questioning my authority...

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Me? NOoooo....

dialogues.speaker: CHI LUNG
dialogues.text: Your loyalty to me is...

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: ...uh..UNquestioned...Totally!

dialogues.speaker: CHI LUNG
dialogues.text: You were a lowly street hood and I made you...  23.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Leader of the Flame Lords, your magnificence, and I am deeply grateful. It's just... well, we need... money.

dialogues.speaker: CHI LUNG
dialogues.text: (angry) Money! You want money?!

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: You know... for expenses last night. Gas, rope...tolls for the bridge...

dialogues.speaker: CHI LUNG
dialogues.text: (angry) Money?! From me?? A FORCE BEAM shoots from Chi's palm, impales Bobby and li him by the throat, levitating him, choking...

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Ah...no. N-never mind. Forget it. Sorry I mentioned it. (Chi turns away. Bobby slams to the floor.) Oooof! I mean, how do you do all this neat evil stuff, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: CHI LUNG
dialogues.text: Oh, you know. The usual. Pact with the devil. Knowledge that is power... all that. But, with certain... limitations. And you know how I hate limitations!

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Oh boy, do I! CHI LUNG calls up images. Chinese ideograms appear.

dialogues.speaker: CHI LUNG
dialogues.text: That's why I've studied the ancient texts.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: The ones you had me steal?

dialogues.speaker: CHI LUNG
dialogues.text: Borrow. Short term loan. They've revealed the CHAI TAO! The SECRET MAGICAL ARTIFACT that will give me

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby snatches the jade from Chi's hand.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: That?... Chi snatches it back. Light dims to just a highlight on C and the jade.

dialogues.speaker: CHI LUNG
dialogues.text: This jade...One of the THREE PIECES separated by YAMA, to prevent their power from falling into...

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: (helpfully) Evil hands? Chi glares daggers at him.

dialogues.speaker: CHI LUNG
dialogues.text: Well, when I have the complete Chai Tao, that won't matter, will it? He opens a curtain revealing the golden statue of the god Yama. He places the jade in the statue's outstretched han An unearthly GONG RINGS. Bobby staggers, holding his ears

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: What the hell is that!

dialogues.speaker: CHI LUNG
dialogues.text: Yes. As a matter of fact, Hell is exactly what it is.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: CHI LUNG
dialogues.text: Yen Lo, Servant of Yama. I summon thee! A THUNDERCLAP! Bobby grabs his ears and cowers. Chi looks down with disdain. And unearthly HOWL. The statues SHUDDE

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Boss, you been dipping into the Bok Fun again!  25.

dialogues.speaker: CHI LUNG
dialogues.text: Pay attention! I have... (He whips out another piece from beneath his robes.) combined TWO PIECES of the Chai Tao. The clock now starts. We have 12 hours from the time the TWO PIECES are combined... to find and take possession of the THIRD.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Or what? Wait a minute...Or what?!

dialogues.speaker: CHI LUNG
dialogues.text: A...slight penalty clause. If we fail to find the third piece we will be slaves of the demons of Hell for all eternity.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Oh, is that all? Huh? What do you mean... "we"? BOBBY grows uneasy as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Statues around the room are changing, coming alive.

dialogues.speaker: CHI LUNG
dialogues.text: Besides I'm sure there's a loophole. ..somewhere. (glances at Bobby) Something bothering you?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Uhh. ..Nothing..No... except ...Maybe...well, if I didn't know better, I'd swear that (points to a gargoyle) that is...coming...to life! (suddenly wants to depart) Listen, don't pay me now. I'll just put it on your tab. Chi places a second JADE PIECE on the altar. They emanate power. A RUMBLING HOWL FROM HELL! Gargoyles move. Terrified, Bobby snatches ONE OF THE JADE PIECES, holds i before him like a protective talisman. Chi is outraged.  26.

dialogues.speaker: CHI LUNG
dialogues.text: What are you doing, you fool!

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: You never mentioned the part about Hell.

dialogues.speaker: CHI LUNG
dialogues.text: Must've slipped my mind.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: If this has power, maybe it'll protect me.

dialogues.speaker: CHI LUNG
dialogues.text: Give me that, you twit! (Bobby shrinks back) Don't worry. You're with me!

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Yeah sure! The guy about to go to Hell. Great! Look, I want protection! Bobby's demand triggers a change. The jade GLOWS. He drop it, burning his hand. Chi snaps it up, hides it in the fo of his robe. The room RUMBLES! Walls EXPLODE! In a burst radiance, Yen Lo arrives. And he is pissed! The Servant of Yama confronts Chi. YEN LO is as big and s as Jack Palance on a bad hair day. He's dressed in blue robes, a conical hat, with a silver serpent embroidered o his chest. He looms over the others, intimidating...

dialogues.speaker: YEN LO
dialogues.text: Who commands me?

dialogues.speaker: CHI LUNG
dialogues.text: I, Chi Lung, have summoned you, Yen Lo, servant of Yama! He shows him the JADE PIECE set in the Yama statue. Yen i shocked.

dialogues.speaker: CHI LUNG
dialogues.text: By this piece of the Chai Tao I lay claim to all power over the universe!

dialogues.speaker: YEN LO
dialogues.text: One piece alone is not enough, Chi Lung. You must now accompany me to HELL... NOW!  27. Chi Lung smatches THE JADE from the Altar and fits it wit the SECOND PIECE he whips out from beneath his robe. A FL Yen Lo is blown back into a dragon throne. The dragons co alive, snake around and hold him fast.

dialogues.speaker: CHI LUNG
dialogues.text: You've grown careless, Yen. I have not one...but two! I now make my claim over the CHAI TAO, and when YOU help me get the THIRD AND FINAL PIECE, ultimate power wi be mine! Yen Lo struggles mightily but the combined power of the t artifacts traps him, holds him on the throne. Bobby's awe

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: You can hold him there?

dialogues.speaker: YEN LO
dialogues.text: Not for long, Chi Lung. The judges have been summoned.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Judges, what judges?

dialogues.speaker: CHI LUNG
dialogues.text: Oh, the ones from Hell. Now, I really NEED the third piece.

dialogues.speaker: YEN LO
dialogues.text: You have just twelve hours!

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Then what?

dialogues.speaker: YEN LO
dialogues.text: All Hell breaks loose. (he laughs chillingly, then snaps to serious threat...) Twelve hours... to take possession of the third piece. Chi waves..-Thunder! Lightning! Flames and smoke break ou The room ROCKS under the evil spell. Chi stands up to it.

dialogues.speaker: CHI LUNG
dialogues.text: Right. And we both know where it is.  28.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve sweeps the last of the glass into the gutter, then walks up to Egg's door. Egg's inside, bustling about. He pulls down more shutters, draws shades, turns the "CLO sign. Steve holds up Egg's broom. Egg looks. After a beat opens the door grabs the broom, tries to slam it again, b Steve holds the door.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Now can we talk?

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: Thank you. No.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: Busy. Too busy. I have a tour to conduct. He nods toward a colorful TOUR BUS parked in the alley.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: A tour, good. I'ma student of Chinese culture myself.

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: I'm busy...very busy.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: We need to talk about... this. Steve holds up a picture of the stolen jade. Egg reacts. slips back inside the shop. Steve follows before he can c the door on him.

dialogues.speaker: EGG
dialogues.text: Who did you say you were, again?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Steve. Steve Taylor.

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: (skeptical) Curator of the Heritage Museum?  29. » STEVE That's my father. I'm the Assistant Curator.

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: And you say you have this jade piece on display at the museum?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Eh... well... we did. Until it got stolen last night.

dialogues.speaker: EGG
dialogues.text: Stolen!

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Yeah, by those friendly guys with the red head bands.

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: The Flame Lords!

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: eo (frightened) Chi Lung!

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Chi Lung?

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: What do you know about this jade piece?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Lots. I know it's part of the Chai Tao. A mystic puzzle that, according to legend, holds the key to all the power in the universe.

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: Myth! Superstition!

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: But you believe it don't you? Egg pushes Steve out the door.  30. » EXT. STREET - TRAVELING They walk to an Egg moves away t Egg stops dead a: Steve obliges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby studies Ye alley, turn, walk up to a gaily painted bus.

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: Ahhh...all you young pups. You are all the same. And if I did believe... do you think I'd tell you?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Why not? Look, I've been studying this subject for nineteen years! I'm an expert.

dialogues.speaker: EGG
dialogues.text: You're a fool.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Not so foolish that I can't tell that you're frightened.

dialogues.speaker: EGG
dialogues.text: Not frightened... just busy! Now let me alone.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: But I need to talk to you. oward the bus.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE, (CONT'D.)
dialogues.text: I know you know about this. I've heard you're something of a... wizard! nd turns.

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: You want to talk? Get on bus. (Steve jumps on. Egg stops him.) But first buy ticket!

dialogues.speaker: FORTRESS
dialogues.text: nm Lo raging within the dragons’ grip.  w ny

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Is he okay there?

dialogues.speaker: CHI LUNG
dialogues.text: Well, if he escapes my control he's going to be rather cross with you!

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Me?! (Chi nods) Well, who's got the other piece? How do we get it? Chi grins down at Yen.

dialogues.speaker: CHI LUNG
dialogues.text: You wouldn't care to tell? (Yen Lo flips him the Chinese Bird.) Egg Shen, perhaps?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: The good wizard?

dialogues.speaker: CHI LUNG
dialogues.text: Good wizard? Good wizard? Oh, he likes to call himself that. Truth is, it's all about power. I've known for years, Egg had the THIRD PIECE. But I didn't dare move until some fool found the SECOND piece and put it on display in a museum!...

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Egg's tough. How do we get the piece away from him?

dialogues.speaker: CHI LUNG
dialogues.text: My plan is simple. In a word... Trouble. Big Trouble.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: That's two words.

dialogues.speaker: CHI LUNG
dialogues.text: {turns and bellows!) Flame Lords! Doors burst open. Flame Lords rush in. They fall into ran at stiff attention. Chi Lung struts before them like Patt  32.

dialogues.speaker: CHI LUNG
dialogues.text: {to Bobby) You give Egg a message. Unless he surrenders the final Chai Tao, Little China will be reduced to... to... Egg Foo Yung! (turns to the ranks) Flame Lords...Out! Out! Begone! Be BAD! Cause Trouble! He claps. The Lords RUSH OUT for a spree of destruction.

dialogues.speaker: STREETS OF LITTLE CHINA
dialogues.text: A GAILY PAINTED TOURIST BUS rumbles down Grant Street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EGG SHEN lectures on Little China. The bus is painted in Chinese motifs finished in red lacquer. Egg looks down th streets, into alleys. He's distracted and lecturing half- heartedly. Steve sits nearby and questions, much to Egg's annoyance -- and to the mystification of the tourists.

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: .No. Chinese men were brought over to work on the railroads. Women followed later but the first generations never really assimilated...

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Yeah, they brought their own beliefs, their mystical priests, their magic.

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: Not true. Actually insulting to Chinese. There are, of course, no such things as demons, sorcery or magic ...within the Chinese scheme of beliefs. Chinese are very rational, law-abiding...

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: What about the Tong wars? At this, Egg swerves the bus over to the curb in front of tea shop, opens the door, turns to the few tourist riders

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: Rest stop. Five minutes. You go shop. Very good tea.  They pile off. Egg turns to Steve, serious, now.

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: Tell me where you found the jade piece.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: I found it. ...by accident... ...in the vault. It was in the Fung collection.

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: Fung was a guardian!? I knew it!

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: A guardian? What's that?

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: Nothing. Never mind. (to himself) Chi would not dare to steal this piece unless he had one other. This is very bad. (catches himself) Anyway...it’s all rumors, all myth.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Maybe, but if it isn't, you might be in danger. Why don't you let me help you?

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: No...no. You do not need to get involved. Thank you. Nothing personal...

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Everything's personal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tourists get back on the bus clutching packages as... A LION DANCE approaches... Tumbling kids, streaming banne Music and gongs. A golden paper Dragon-Lion weaves down t street dancing, leaping, blocking traffic, blocking the b as the tourists climb back aboard and take seats. One lad (ALMA) proudly shows off a souvenir.

dialogues.speaker: ALMA
dialogues.text: Look Ida. A piece of the great wall. Steve looks askance...  34.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: The great wall...really! You sent them there, Egg. You're a fraud!

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: Look. If you really had a piece of the great wall would you sell it toa woman in an “Elvis Lives" T-shirt?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: So... you give them what they want to see -- and hide the real Chinatown... the real magic. Steve notices a picture of a Chinese kid taped to the das

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: By the way... who's this?

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: Kok Leong. My Son. (shakes his head sadly) He's developing condos in Miami Beach. Not so easy to find respect for the old ways in the new generation. Too many distractions.

dialogues.speaker: BACK OF THE BUS
dialogues.text: ALMA and her friend IDA look at the passing parade, fascinated, clicking their Kodaks. The kid in the lion he leaps on another's shoulders. He shakes and roars.

dialogues.speaker: IDA
dialogues.text: Oh look, Alma, a Lion Dance. Isn't that cute... The Lion leaps at the window. She raises her camera. The lion’s mouth opens. She snaps a nice Close-Up of a fearso FLAME LORD. He SCREAMS at her.

dialogues.speaker: FLAME LORD
dialogues.text: Ng ho ying sheung! Bok gwei! (Don't take photos, White Ghost!) He smashes the window and grins madly.

dialogues.speaker: IDA
dialogues.text: She's gone rigid, too shocked to scream. Her companion ha seen a thing. She turns to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that, Ida? Then she notices Ida's face and the grinning Flame Lord. She...SCREAMS!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tourists sit terrified as lion dancers smash into the bus

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: So there's no current gang activity?

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: In Chinatown? Of course not. Just as Egg says it, more Flame Lords burst from an alley sweep up the street, creating chaos. They overturn trashc knock over cyclists. They leap at the bus, run up the sid dance on the roof. Tourists SCREAM! Doors burst open. Fla Lords fly in.

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: It's nothing. Don't be alarmed. Just a Lion Dance. All part of the show.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: (smashes a window) A message from Chi Lung.

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: Flame Lords! Begone! You cannot do this!

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Wrong. This is just a start. You have something Chi Lung wants. And until he gets it, we take what we want. Egg slams it into gear, pops the clutch, sending Flame Lo tumbling. Bobby's up, hopping over tourists. He leaps for Egg. They struggle. Bobby yanks the wheel. The bus crashe into a car. Passengers tumble. Flame Lords come forward. Steve again takes a martial arts stance. They laugh, then stop laughing and advance toward him.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: No. You still ain't got it. Look. It's like this.  w “I He snaps into a Martial Arts stance. They surround Steve. Shen moves up, takes a stance next to Steve. He's old, bu something about him says ‘don't mess with me.'

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: Bok Sum! White Hearts! It's a Call To Arms. It echoes through...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All along Grant Street, Street Lights in the form of CHIN LANTERNS GLOW...They PULSE BRIGHTLY...A MESSAGE.

dialogues.speaker: ALL OVER CHINATOWN
dialogues.text: Kids note the flickering lanterns. They slip into alleys storefronts, parked cars. They re-emerge wearing white jackets with blue and green trim and matching headbands. are...THE WHITE HEARTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby moves on Egg, stalking, feinting attacks.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Give up the jade! SUDDENLY - The White Hearts appear and engage the Flame Lords. The leader's a good-looking youth: JACKSON "DOUBLE CHIN. He moves and fights so fast, he's a blur, (like see double). All over the street, in the bus, on top of the bus...White Hearts fight the Flame Lords to a standstill. Then they drive them back. Then SIRENS, POLICE. Suddenly, Flame Lords' position is untenable. Steve faces off again Bobby, but Bobby gives a sign... a challenge.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: We'll meet again.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: I'm looking forward to it. The Lords leap out the door, chased by the White Hearts. a wink, they're all gone. Egg Shen slumps with an injured shoulder. He tries to tur the wheel but can't. He winces in pain. Steve pulls him o from behind the wheel, drags him to a seat.

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: What are you doing?  38.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Just helping out.

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: No, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Don't worry. It'll be fine. In the back, some tourists are terrified.

dialogues.speaker: TOURIST 1
dialogues.text: What was that?!! Some are irate.

dialogues.speaker: TOURIST 2
dialogues.text: What about our tour?

dialogues.speaker: TOURIST 1
dialogues.text: Yeah! We paid for a tour. Steve glances at Egg Shen. He has a pained look on his fa

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Sorry folks, tour's over.

dialogues.speaker: TOURIST 1
dialogues.text: At least get us back to our hotel. They look at Egg Shen. He hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Look, I can drive. More or less. Whadaya got to lose? He slips into the driver's seat, starts up, grinding gear

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: Hey kid!

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: Ever driven a bus before?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Hey, how hard can it be? CRASH! Steve looks outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That car was already damaged. It shouldn't count against me. BOOOMM! He rips off the side of a parked car.

dialogues.speaker: TOURIST 2
dialogues.text: Oh, you can let us out here.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Don't be silly. It's nothing. No trouble at all. Steve tries to pull out, but the tourists clamber off the bus, leaving him with Egg.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Now what was that you were saying about the Chai Tao being a myth? Egg slams the door.

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: How do you know such things?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: PHd. Asian Studies. Berkeley.

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: Oh...book learning!

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: In the seventh century A.D. in the Hsia (Sha) period of Mythical Sages, the Court of Xuang Wa was overrun by horsemen from the north. The Imperial Wizard, Fu Hsi, inventor of the eight trigrams, sacrificed the most beautiful maidens in the Three Kingdoms to the Hell God, Yama, Keeper of the Gate...in return for a secret power to keep the Barbarians at bay. This power was contained in the Chai Tao. As you know. A beat. Egg's impressed, but dismissive.

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: Alright... so it was a good book. But you still know nothing about the real China. 39.  40.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Why... because I'm not Chinese?

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: No. Because you are a Saw jai! (young fool)

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: If I am a Saw jai, you are a Lo Saw See Fool! (foolish old man) I'm offering you help... And by the looks of things, you could sure use some.

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: No. I don't need your help. A BLAST OF THUNDER. LIGHTNING FLASHES, clouds let go.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Sure about that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LIGHTNING FLASHES SPARK around Chi Lung as he glares at t Flame Lords straggling in...and at Bobby, empty-handed.

dialogues.speaker: CHI LUNG
dialogues.text: Where's the Jade?! (Bobby shrugs helplessly) What about Egg Shen?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: He has what you might call, a bad attitude.

dialogues.speaker: CHI LUNG
dialogues.text: So?itt!

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: There were White Hearts, and cops... and some pain-in-the- butt Anglo guy.

dialogues.speaker: CHI LUNG
dialogues.text: Excuses! I ask for the Chai Tao. You bring me excuses!

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Well, we scared them some...  41.

dialogues.speaker: CHI LUNG
dialogues.text: Very good. The only way to control people is through fear. (then) That gives me an idea... He walks up to Yen Lo and stares. Yen Lo glares back.

dialogues.speaker: CHI LUNG
dialogues.text: Through Yen Lo, other demons can be summoned and you, my Flame Lords... will have the honor of serving as their willing vessels... There's muttering in the ranks. Chi turns to them, fixes with his glare.

dialogues.speaker: FLAME LORD 1
dialogues.text: Willing vessels ?! Geez, your worship... I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: CHI LUNG
dialogues.text: Then shall Little China be brought to its knees... and Egg Shen will be forced to give up his jade!

dialogues.speaker: FLAME LORD 2
dialogues.text: But my Lord, I... I mean... if they... if they inhabit our bodies, what happens to us?

dialogues.speaker: FLAME LORD 1
dialogues.text: Yeah, what if we're not willing? Chi's grin freezes. He levels a scary killer stare at the miscreant. Then he claps his hands. Flame Lord One bursts into flame, burns fiercely, turns to ash. A moment of stu Silence. The other Lords get the point.

dialogues.speaker: FLAME LORD 2
dialogues.text: Demons. That's not so bad.

dialogues.speaker: CHI LUNG
dialogues.text: You will have more power than you ever dreamed of... Chi Lung moves to Yen Lo.

dialogues.speaker: YEN LO
dialogues.text: You know the price for demons, Chi Lung?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, of course, virgins. Standard price. One virgin for each demon. I so demand!

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: CHI LUNG
dialogues.text: Find me 13 beautiful virgins!

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: In San Francisco? Chi glares daggers at him, snaps his fingers. Bobby's hai glows. Flames dance about his face. He's terrified.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Virgins. Right! Good idea. Much prefer them, myself. Bobby's becoming disillusioned. He notices a new transformation in Chi. His features have distorted.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Are you okay, Wise One?

dialogues.speaker: CHI LUNG
dialogues.text: It's nothing....Hormone imbalance. It makes me very... Boom! A beam SHOOTS from his hands, levitates Bobby by a terrible grip on his throat.

dialogues.speaker: CHI LUNG, (CONT'D.)
dialogues.text: ...irritable.

dialogues.speaker: YEN LO
dialogues.text: Very well. You asked for Demons! Day Die Gwei Lei La! (Hell God, come to me!) He claps his hands. Around him Demons coalesce, swirl and stream out, up, into..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One by one the Flame Lords are possessed. Their eyes glow with fire, their tongues turn black, steam comes out of t ears. They do a crazy, hip-hop demon dance.  43.

dialogues.speaker: CHI LUNG
dialogues.text: Now...that's the spirit! Bobby notices that he himself hasn't changed.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Hey Boss. What about me?

dialogues.speaker: CHI LUNG
dialogues.text: Mindless slaves are only so useful. Your loyalty is unquestioned. Right?!

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Oh, absolutely your worshipfulness.

dialogues.speaker: CHI LUNG
dialogues.text: Good. Now... DEMONS!! They snap to attention.

dialogues.speaker: CHI LUNG, (CONT'D.)
dialogues.text: Get those virgins while I make special arrangements for Egg Shen. Demons...

dialogues.speaker: BEGONE
dialogues.text: He makes a magical wave. The demonic Flame Lords disappea @ a burst of lightning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Above Little China, clouds roll in, thunder and spiked lightning... a Chinese Walpurgisnacht. The storm cloud se to hang directly over Chinatown like another dimension of darkness, rain and mystery. Egg's bus zooms by the China Gate. A police car pulls out and follows. INT. POLICE CAR. Clarence guns it, grabs the radio mike, calls in.

dialogues.speaker: CLARENCE
dialogues.text: Unit Twelve. I've got Egg at the China Gate. I'm going in. Something's happening in Little China. I want back up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus zips through but Clarence, following closely, see to hit a magical barrier. The GATE BULGES IN AND SNAPS BA The car stalls. Clarence is out, tries to run through the * BARRIER, but is thrown back as if bounced off a trampol  44.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PACIFIC POWER truck weaves through a downpour. INT. TRUCK. Kim and BRAD, wrestle their truck through the wet streets

dialogues.speaker: BRAD
dialogues.text: Jeez, look at that! Looks like it's hanging right over Chinatown. Maybe we should get help.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Pull yourself together, Brad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Egg's bus pulls into the alley. Egg hops out and scurries off, distracted. He disappears into the back door of his shop, Steve is suddenly left alone. Hesitantly, he follow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What Steve sees amazes him. Everywhere he looks, books, artifacts, objets d'art... It's a curator's wet dream. Th back of the store is a maze, a rabbit's warren of boxes a shelves piled to the ceiling with (cheap props).

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Wow! Look at this stuff. Shen! Mr. Egg! The Yut Lick Tung Sing! The Chinese almanac; the T'ang codex. Mr. Egg, can I have a word with you? Steve walks through the maze to the front of the shop, fascinated. It too is filled with ancient, weird Chinese things... dusty books, artifacts, curios of all types. Bu messier... stuff tumbled all over. Then he looks up.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Geeez! Egg... what a mess! You really keep this stuff on the floor? Egg glares at him. Steve looks again. The shop's been trashed!

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: Someone's been here.  45.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Looking for something...looks like...

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: Flame Lords. Egg pushes Steve toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: I don't have time for you. Thank you. Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Goodbye?! No. Wait... you can't do that! (Egg turns back...) I have some questions. But Egg's distracted. He looks out at the gathering storm moves around the shop muttering to himself and gathering old dusty jars filled with strange powders and liquids.

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: No. It's dangerous. Too dangerous. You must go. Egg shoos him out and closes the shop.

dialogues.speaker: END OF EGG'S STREET
dialogues.text: Kim and Brad pull up in spooky darkness and flickering po lines. One sparking line is attached to Egg's shop. All o Chinatown lights flicker and flash.

dialogues.speaker: BRAD
dialogues.text: Jeez. It's dark!

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Very observant. Come on. She hops out but Brad is reluctant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Electricity crackles from downed powerlines. All business Kim slips on a hardhat, a climbing belt. She gracefully a powerfully scales the pole. Brad is spooked.

dialogues.speaker: BRAD
dialogues.text: Kim...be careful.  46.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Cut the power, Brad. Brad opens up a manhole and slips down to cut the circuit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve stamds outside in the rain. Egg Shen can't believe He goes to the door, arms full of magical elements, jars, powders, potions... He's exasperated.

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: What do you think you're doing?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Admit it. You're testing me.

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: Worse. I'm ignoring you.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: I saw it on Kung Fu. All the other students ran off when it rained. Grasshopper stayed where he was.

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: Grasshopper was an ACTOR! Egg slams the door. Steve stands dripping in the rain. Th door opens.

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: Am I supposed to be impressed by someone too dumb to get out of the rain?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Confucious says, “The journey of a thousand miles starts with one step".

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: Confucius also said, ‘Get Lost! He slams the door.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: That part must've been lost in translation. He jumps at a particularly vicious crash of lightning.  47.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lightning strikes the tops of buildings and ripples a the eaves like St. Elmo's Fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DEMON LORD slams a crank. The cookie machine goes into overdrive. Cookies fly out like tiny frisbees. Cooks flee screaming as cookies whiz by their heads.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE CHINA
dialogues.text: The Demon Lords fan out through Chinatown, yanking poor helpless girls away from their screaming, frightened families. They hold their demon features under cloaks and hats...in shadow, barely but scarily glimpsed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Flame Lords run up to a family. One grabs a pretty gi They tear her away from her screaming parents, run off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lords spot other pretty young girls. They rush up pushing bystanders aside, grab them swing them on their cycles, R away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby, Yee and the demons run up to another girl, cowerin

dialogues.speaker: YEE
dialogues.text: Virgin? She looks at her mom and dad...

dialogues.speaker: MEI LI
dialogues.text: Errr. Yes. A Lord turns back to her, Bobby.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Mei Li?

dialogues.speaker: MEI LI
dialogues.text: Bobby Wong!

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: (to Yee) ‘Fraid not.  48. She looks sheepishly from him back and forth to her paren Her mother glares at her. The demon ROARS, runs off, Bobb grins, waves goodbye to Mei Li, leaving her parents trembling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kim's on the power line in insulated boots and gloves, searching for the source of the outage. She looks around.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: I just fixed this thing... Strange. Only Little China seems affected. A bolt of lightning strikes nearby.

dialogues.speaker: BRAD
dialogues.text: Kim, Come down! It's too dangerous!

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: I'm perfectly sa... Another bolt ripples down the building eaves, hits the po knocks Kim off her perch. She dangles by her safety strap stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve comes out stufing an egg roll into his mouth. He lo up, stops chewing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: St. Elmo's Fire ripples along the roofs and eaves of Chinatown. It sparks and snakes down the powerlines to th light poles, shorting them. Steve is awed. He reaches out touches the pole. The fire leaps to his hand, up his arm, engulfs his body. His hair stands up with static charge.. stands hands out, entranced...glorying in the magic.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: It's real!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve rushes up, sees the power truck, sees Kim on the po  43.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Hey Kim, you should see this. Cold fire. Just like what was written in the T'ang codex. He looks closer, sees Kim dangling. Without hesitation, h leaps for the pole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad calls her on the intercom but gets no answer. Curiou

dialogues.speaker: BRAD
dialogues.text: Kim, Kim. Are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: THE POLE
dialogues.text: She's stunned, hanging in her straps. Steve's climbing up He reaches her, unhooks her, takes her in his arms just a rampaging Demon Flame Lords appear.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Brad?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Steve.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Steve?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Bok Gwei.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Oh...you.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Hang on. A beat. Then she throws her arms around him and hangs on.

dialogues.speaker: THE STREET
dialogues.text: A Flame Lord drops into the manhole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The demon knocks Brad aside, starts crossing circuits. Terrified, Brad scrambles out of there.  w

dialogues.speaker: ALL OVER CHINATOWN
dialogues.text: signs explode, bulbs vaporize. Flashes...then darkness, except for the glow from the Flame Lords’ eyes. EXT. EGG'’S ANTIQUITES SHOP - ANGLE EGG Egg sees the Demon Flame Lords rush past.

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: White Hearts!

dialogues.speaker: ALL OVER CHINATOWN
dialogues.text: Chinese lantern street lights come on, PULSE BRIGHTLY. Ki note the call, slip into alleys, emerge as WHITE HEARTS.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE POLE
dialogues.text: Steve holds the stunned Kim, about to drop down when he s the FLAME LORDS standing below. Bobby grins up at him.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Get away from us. Leave us alone.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Or what? He makes a mocking martial arts gesture. Just then, THE W HEARTS appear. They mix it up with the Lords but cannot defeat these Kung-Fu Demons from Hell. Steve carries Kim to the ground where Brad battles the Fl Lords. The fight swirls around them. He carries her past into the shop to safety. Brad throws the Flame Lords off, scrambles to his truck, dives in, slams the door, locks i fumbles around for his keys as Demons beat on the sides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He directs the White Hearts with gestures.

dialogues.speaker: YEN LO, (O0.S.)
dialogues.text: The jade, old man. He turns as the LOOMING, POWERFULLY DEMONIC figure appear

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: Yen Lo!!  51. The White Hearts are stunned to discover that the DEMON F LORDS HAVE VANISHED. Egg turns away, runs into his shop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Egg enters. Yen Lo is already there, waiting, glowering.

dialogues.speaker: YEN LO
dialogues.text: Surrender the jade. Chi Lung has so decreed.

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: (furious) Chi Lung?! Chi Lung cannot decree anything! Chi Lung appears in a burst of flame glaring imperiously.

dialogues.speaker: CHI LUNG
dialogues.text: Not yet! Tell him, Yen Lo.

dialogues.speaker: YEN LO
dialogues.text: Chi Lung possesses two parts of the Chai Tao. Chi glowers. Yen Lo moves around the shop, examining a du book here, an artifact there. He passes Steve and the sem consious Kim, hiding behind a desk. Steve pulls back to a being seen but glances around the desk, fascinated...

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: Two?!! How did he get two??

dialogues.speaker: CHI LUNG
dialogues.text: I got the first from Chiang Kai Shek. The second one’I got when some moron put it on display in the museum. Egg shoots a look at a very embarassed Steve.

dialogues.speaker: YEN LO
dialogues.text: (to Egg) You must come with me.

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: Come with you? Where?

dialogues.speaker: CHI LUNG
dialogues.text: He wants to torture you. You know how he is.  52.

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: Yah, love to. Actually, I've got this dentist appointment.. Egg slides toward his shelf... toward ancient potions. Ye moves to keep Egg's hands in sight. Egg stalls...

dialogues.speaker: CHI LUNG
dialogues.text: If I were you, Egg, I wouldn't waste his time. It makes him very...cross! A RIPPLE OF THUNDER. A FLASH.

dialogues.speaker: CHI LUNG, (CONT'D.)
dialogues.text: If I don't get the THIRD PIECE right now you... I ...I...will reduce Chinatown to rubble! Egg slips his hands toward his potions, but Chi spots the move. A MAGICAL CHARGE from Chi Lung blows them out of hi reach. Egg turns on Chi... moves into fighting position.

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: It's been a long time, Chi.

dialogues.speaker: CHI LUNG
dialogues.text: Yes it has, Egg. Egg grins, goes on guard. They circle. Yen drops his hand like a referee. In a flash, Egg and Chi are mixing it, fu contact, full speed. Kicks, flips, twisters. Evenly match fast as a blur. They fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve moves out to see. He cannot believe his eyes. A FLA Chi's got his jade out. A FORCE BEAM BURSTS from it, but ducks, meets the beam with his own. He flips, kicks the j out of Chi's hand. The two pieces fly apart. One piece fl to Yen who catches it. Chi scurries after the other piece grabs it. But Egg's in full control of his power. His bea blasts Chi, blows him right through the window, hanging f dear life onto his piece of the jade. Yen, holding his pi is also sucked into the vortex...and follows Chi out. Ste is caught in the vortex by the powerful force... He grabs lightpole as he is whipped by, clings to it fora beat....then is WHIPPED AWAY...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Egg and Kim rush out, catch a glimpse of Chi and Yen Lo disappearing. They search the sky for Steve.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Steve!?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Huhhh?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: He lies in a pile of trash, stunned, then he picks himsel up. Brad runs up.

dialogues.speaker: BRAD
dialogues.text: What the hell was that? Those Flame Lords...Where'd they go? Egg turns and walks back inside. Steve rushes to follow.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Wait! Steve grabs Kim to support himself. They stumble back ins

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Did you see that?

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: BRAD
dialogues.text: Two weird guys flying through the air.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Yeah, they burst out of here and..just phfft! like that... straight up

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: They will be back.  54. Kim just stares at him. But Steve is concentrating. He go to a reference book Egg's left fallen open on the shelf. flips through rapidly searching... finding...

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Wait a minute I know that guy! That was.. (finds an ancient picture... an imposing figure in conical hat, robe and silver chest serpent) ..-Yen Lo! Servant of Yama... You know who that is?

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: You...are one strange Anglo. Steve looks up, suddenly realizes...

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Where's Egg? They turn around. No Egg Shen. The store seems deserted a half destroyed in the fight. But Steve sees a glimmer of light, a wisp of vapor from behind a shelf

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Yama. The Chai Tao. Have you ever heard of Dai dei... Chinese Hell?

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Chinese Hell?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Yeah...the ten levels?

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. Myths... Stories my grandmother used to tell. Steve studies the wall, then pulls open a Buddha to revea passageway into a maze of boxes and shelf-lined corridors

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Myths, huh? Gestures toward the dark passage. A pause.  55.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: After you. They step through leaving Brad. Outside, demons howl. He doesn't want to be left there. He steps through.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAZE
dialogues.text: It's dark and spooky. Dimly seen shapes. Brad tags along confused, scared look on his face. Kim and Steve creep scrunched together, arguing.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: (scornful, skeptical) Sorcerers, guys flying through the air..ten levels of Hell...

dialogues.speaker: BRAD
dialogues.text: What ten levels? Ten levels of what?

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: The Ten Levels of Hell. Let's see...you're put before some mirror or something.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: The 'Mirror of Retribution'. That's the first level.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Yeah, right.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Your sins determine your form upon reincarnation.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: So, Brad. You'd come back as a rabbit.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Or a lazy soul might come back as an ox. She stops.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: That's what Grandma Hong used to say... She looks at him with interest as he rattles on. But he's searching through the boxes, examining objects and seems be following some unseen intellectual or spiritual trail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the second level, the gossiper has his tongue pierced.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: The glutton is starved...

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: The thief has to kneel on steel granules.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: (getting interested) ...the irreligious are sawed to pieces, the wicked are boiled in a cauldron...

dialogues.speaker: BRAD
dialogues.text: Whew! And I thought Catholicism was tough!

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: It gets worse. On the Third Level of Hell, the disrespectful have their hearts, eyes and livers torn out. On the Fourth, the sinful are thrown into a river of fire. Liars get split lips.

dialogues.speaker: BRAD
dialogues.text: You must be a lotta laughs at parties. Where are we, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: IM
dialogues.text: Isn't the Fifth where cheaters have their hearts torn out with hooks.

dialogues.speaker: BRAD
dialogues.text: Hooks?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Hooks. On the Sixth, thieves are gnawed by rats.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: On the Seventh, torn apart by dogs.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: On the Eighth, run over, made to swallow burning oil... their skulls smashed. You remember, now? 56.  57. Kim is getting intrigued...despite herself. Suddenly, it' weird mantra... as if she's seducing him.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Yeah, and on the Ninth, addicts are attacked by snakes and dismembered.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Yeah, I hate when that happens. And in the Tenth court, final judgement is passed.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Yeah... Kim and Steve. A moment. A look. Interest. Brad's oblivio

dialogues.speaker: BRAD
dialogues.text: Whew! And you guys believe all this? Then the mood breaks. Kim is her rational self again.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: It's as real as two little men flying through the... She gapes at what she sees up ahead.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: What the... Egg... Egg?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Egg Shen is in a cul-de-sac, a shrine surrounded by magic implements and weapons.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: He can't hear you. He's in the Yum Lo trance. It's what a Spirit Warrier does to prepare himself before a battle. Egg is in a trance and levitated a few inches off the flo Behind him THE THIRD CHAI TAO JADE glows softly in an alt niche, emanating a glowing pulse...

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE CHI LUNG'S FORTRESS HQ
dialogues.text: Yen Lo CRASHES through a skylight. The jade piece he had grabbed skitters across the floor. Unsteadily he gets to feet, straightens his robes. He looks around.  58. Chi Lung snatches the SECOND JADE PIECE off the floor and » fits them back together. Now in control, Chi glares furiously, his Flame Lords nearby.

dialogues.speaker: YEN LO
dialogues.text: You failed to get the third piece. The old wizard is stronger than you.

dialogues.speaker: CHI LUNG
dialogues.text: He won't be for long. I'm not through yet. At a gesture from Chi, Yen Lo is sucked to the dragon cha Dragons snake around him.

dialogues.speaker: YEN LO
dialogues.text: You have six hours left. Then, I think I will bite the top of your skull off and suck out your lungs through your spinal column.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind the levitated Egg, the THIRD PIECE OF THE CHAI TAO e glows softly. Unable to stop himself, Steve moves up. H touches the jade. A FLASH! Egg drops to the the floor.

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: Ooof!

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: What's happened?

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: Chi Lung's got two pieces of the Chai Tao. He's also got just a few hours to get my piece or go to Hell. He'll do anything to get it. Even if it means destroying Little China. (turns to his work) Leave me now.

dialogues.speaker: BRAD
dialogues.text: Good idea!

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Why don't you trust me? I just want to help.  59.

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) You just want to learn the magic.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: That too.

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: You can learn nothing unless your heart is true. Egg takes the jade, slips away... It's so fast, for a mom they don't realize he's gone. Then Steve runs to catch up

dialogues.speaker: BRAD
dialogues.text: Okaaaay! That pretty much leaves us out of the picture. Let's go. He tries to lead Kim off. She doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: No. Wait.

dialogues.speaker: BRAD
dialogues.text: Wait! For what?

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Nothing. I'm... I'm curious, that's all.

dialogues.speaker: BRAD
dialogues.text: You don't believe in this stuff, do you?

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Magic? Course not. She hurries after Egg and Steve.

dialogues.speaker: BRAD
dialogues.text: Hey...Wait! Brad brings up the rear. Kim finds Steve. Egg scurries on ahead. Steve has stopped to study an object.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Chu'an do. Amazing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: » What's that?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: An ancient surgical instrument. These people... your people... were doing open heart surgery four centuries before Christ.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Since when is a guy like you so interested in Chinese culture?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Since I was a kid growing up with my father in China. The first image I can remember is the Gum Lung ceremony.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: The first image I can remember is "The Flintstones”. That breaks the spell. e STEVE Don't you wonder...? I mean, we're so modern... so... arrogant. But we have no idea of the beauty of the ancient ways... of what was lost over time. Of what the real powers are...

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: You mean my grandma's stories?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Not stories... but traditions. The ancient rituals. The Myths. Even today's China isn't China anymore. There's even a fast food burger joint across from the Forbidden City.

dialogues.speaker: BRAD
dialogues.text: You know, I'm hungry.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: ...Only in certain areas... well hidden... do the ancient s live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have a moment. Steve turns. Brad's there, frowning.

dialogues.speaker: BRAD
dialogues.text: Can we get on with this? I’m starved. For me, eating is an ancient mystery. Kim glances at Steve. Kim smiles, glances

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: The magic has left China. But I think it's here...in Little China. This jade...it's the key...proof of the existence of ancient beliefs. at Brad, then slips away. Egg's busy. With mental powers alone, he repairs objects broken in the fight reassembles itself Egg putters around Pieces fly onto shelves, broken pottery Kim's slips in. Her mouth drops open.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: How did you...? combining ingredients into spheres.

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: Magic perhaps.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: You don't expect me to believe that?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: You know what I think? That the wise ones like Egg allow the ancient secrets to fall into myth. The less the public knows the better.

dialogues.speaker: EGG SHEN
dialogues.text: Yes... it's a constant struggle to keep the ancient beliefs alive yet secret... and to find young people with the moral character to become guardians of the CHAI TAO. He looks intently at Kim. She turns away. Egg looks pensi

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
